meanings.definition: Repair or replace the heel of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: I need to reheel my favorite boots before the party.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reheel her worn-out shoes instead of buying new ones.
meanings.sent3: The cobbler had a magical ability to reheel shoes in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Watching the cobbler reheel shoes was like witnessing a shoe transformation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer hitting the nails as he reheel the shoe echoed in the shop.

meanings.definition: To put a new heel on a shoe.
meanings.sent1: After years of use, it was time to reheel her favorite pair of shoes.
meanings.sent2: He learned how to reheel shoes from his grandfather who was a cobbler.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer decided to reheel all her shoes with colorful heels.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a new person every time she reheel her shoes with different designs.
meanings.sent5: The cobbler's hands moved skillfully as he reheel the shoe, making it look brand new.
